alert.note: Alert for Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 5:14PM MDT until June 22 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Tripp County in south central South Dakota... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 614 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, roads, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Tripp County, southeast of Colome, along Ponca Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
